result.execSummary:
The defendant Juan Jose Rodriguez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Release for work, good time credit.

miscConds.notes:
- Restitution set at $0.
- Pay mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges, including DNA, during term of probation. Failure to pay results in a civil judgment.
- Full time work, school or a combination.
- Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

- No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription, no illegal drugs and no alcohol.
- No further violations of the law.
- Court will grant expungement upon successful completion of probation.

- AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
- Absolute sobriety, random urine screens.

timeConds.notes:
With release for work: 30 days to be served up front with a report date of 05-13-2022 by 5pm.
Court STAYED 60 days, to be used at discretion of Probation Agent.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Juan Jose Rodriguez

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Juan Jose Rodriguez in court with attorney Paul K Kuszel.  Amanda Korin Kirklewski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held via Zoom.   Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state.

As to Count 1: Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible. 

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by parties and defendant. 
As to Count 1: Defendant ordered to serve 12 months in the House of Correction, release for work, good time credit. Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 18 months with the following conditions:

- Serve 3 months in the House of Correction as a condition time sentence with release for work: 30 days to be served up front with a report date of 05-13-2022 by 5pm. Court STAYED 60 days, to be used at discretion of Probation Agent.
- AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
- Absolute sobriety, random urine screens.
- No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription, no illegal drugs and no alcohol
- Full time work, school or a combination.
- 50 hours of community service.
- No further violations of the law.
- Cooperate with agent.
- Restitution set at $0.
- Pay mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges, including DNA, during term of probation. Failure to pay results in a civil judgment. 

Court ordered defendant's driving privileges revoked for 6 months. 

Court will grant expungement upon successful completion of probation. 

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

Attorney Paul K Kuszel in court, defendant Juan Jose Rodriguez not in court, in custody.  Allysa Bria Brown appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held via Zoom. Defense requests a plea and sentencing date. Case adjourned, Branch 2 via Zoom.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 28, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Juan Jose Rodriguez in court with Attorney Paul Kuszel.  Defendant Juan Jose Rodriguez in custody.  Matthew Zisi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 02, Judge Childs. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Adjustment Number: 22A 012846,
Payable Number: 984275,
Receipt Number: 22RP005448,
Amount: $20.00

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.
  No possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription.

12:06 PM Defendant Juan Jose Rodriguez in court with attorney Nicholas M Weege.  Defendant Juan Jose Rodriguez in custody.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.

Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
K-Warrant
